PP Notes: Certificate of Conformity is needed for any importer/manufacturer to evidence compliance with the requirements and should be carried by local certification body. The certificate of Conformity (CoC) will be issued by certification body (i.e. SGS Columbia is one of it) basing on testing reports, QMS certificate etc. documents. The eventual certificate will be valid for 3 years and is subject to annual follow up.
Shall comply with the NTC EN 71-1 mechanical and physical requirements. (acceptable equivalent standards: EN 71-1, ASTM F963, ISO 8124-1)
Shall comply with the NTC EN 71-2 Flammability requirements. (acceptable equivalent standards: EN 71-2, ASTM F963, ISO 8124-2)
Shall comply with the NTC EN 71-3 Migration of Certain Elements requirements. (acceptable equivalent standards: EN 71-3)
Toys for children under three years of age, the below six phthalates (BBP, DBP, DOP or DEHP, DNOP, DINP and DIDP) total content should not exceed 0.1%, reference to EN 14372.
Shall comply with the EN 62115 Electronic Toy requirements.
Spanish
Factory name must be present
Importer or authorized distributor in Colombia must be present on the label
Reference No. & Batch number must be present.
Minimum age must be clearly specified.

Warnings must be present in Spanish language. Warnings must be in accordance to the age grading, the presence of small parts and use of the product. Graphical symbols for age warning in accordance with NTC EN 71-1.

TL EA: Gradual reduction of single-use plastic products
PP Notes: Colombia’s Law No. 2232 of 2022 aiming to ensure that by 2030, most single-use plastics and containers placed on the Colombian market will be biodegradable, reusable or made with locally sourced post-consumer recycled materials. Applies to non-banned single-use plastics, mandatory recycled content: PET water bottles: 50% by 2025 → 90% by 2030; Other PET bottles: 20% by 2025 → 35% by 2030 → 60% by 2040; Collection target: 50% by 2030; No imported waste allowed to meet targets.
